summary: The QUAHOGS Act of 2025 aims to address the challenges facing bivalve populations, particularly quahogs (hard clams), along the East Coast. It establishes an East Coast Bivalve Research Task Force to review existing research, identify research gaps, and develop strategies for sustainable fisheries and aquaculture. The task force will focus on understanding the impacts of climate change, diseases, and other threats to these shellfish, and will make recommendations for conservation and management. The bill also authorizes appropriations for the task force's activities.
